notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an administrative user unintentional access to the underlying operating system of the device.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
NCCIC provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC also recommends that users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target this vulnerability.
notes.title: Exploitability

revision_history.summary: ICSA-19-183-02 Quest KACE Systems Management Appliance

notes.text: The vulnerability allows unintentional access to the appliance leveraging functions of the troubleshooting tools located in the administrator user interface. CVE-2019-10973 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 2.7 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Quest recommends affected users upgrade to Version 9.1 or newer, which can be downloaded from the Quest support portal at the following link:
